title: Zoo train sells for $29K at auction
text: LOUISVILLE, KY (WAVE) – The train that derailed, injuring 22 people at the Louisville Zoo in June 2009, has sold at auction. The life-size train sold for $29,000 in an online auction that ended at 8 p.m. Wednesday. [PREVIOUS STORY: $6 million settlement reached in final claim related to Louisville Zoo train crash] Louisville Metro put the 2000 CHANCE model train up for auction Tuesday morning. Bidding started at $10,000 for the lot that included one engine, three cars and seven trucks. In the listing, the city clarified the train has not been operated since the 2009 crash, and the operating condition is unknown. The train was sold as-is with no warranty. After the crash, the city paid more than $6 million in legal settlements. Copyright 2016 WAVE 3 News. All rights reserved.
